Module contents¶

Generic dataset class

class cortex.datasets.BasicDataset(data, distributions=None, labels='label', name=None, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: cortex.datasets.Dataset

Dataset with numpy arrays as inputs. No visualization available.

Arrays must be a dictionary of name/numpy array key/value pairs.

data¶

dict – dictionary of numpy.array.

n¶

int – number of data samples.

dims¶

dict – dictionary of data dimensions.

distributions¶

dict – dictionary of strings. See models.distributions for details.

X¶

numpy.array – MRI data.

Y¶

Optional[numpy.array] – If not None, lables.

mean_image¶

numpy.array – mean image of primary data.

balance_labels()[source]¶

Balanced the dataset.

next(batch_size=None)[source]¶

Draws the next batch of data samples.

Parameters:batch_size (int) –
Returns:Dictionary of data.
Return type:dict
randomize()[source]¶

Randomizes the dataset

class cortex.datasets.Dataset(batch_size=None, shuffle=True, inf=False, name='dataset', mode=None, stop=None, balance=False, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: object

Base dataset iterator class.

batch_size¶

int – batch size for the iterator.

shuffle¶

bool – shuffle the dataset after each epoch.

inf¶

bool – reset the dataset after iterating through who set.

name¶

str – name of the dataset.

pos¶

int – current position of the iterator.

stop¶

int – stop the dataset at this index when loading.

mode¶

str – usually train, test, valid.

balance¶

bool – replicate samples to balance the dataset.

randomize()[source]¶

Randomize the dataset.

reset()[source]¶

Reset the dataset post-epoch.

save_images(*args)[source]¶

Save images.

cortex.datasets.fetch_basic_data()[source]¶

Fetch the basic dataset for demos.

cortex.datasets.load_data(dataset=None, train_batch_size=None, valid_batch_size=None, test_batch_size=None, resolve_dataset=None, **dataset_args)[source]¶

Load dataset with a predefined split.

For these datasets, train/valid/test split has already been made. For the batch sizes, if any are None, the corresponding dataset will also be None.

Parameters:
  • dataset (str) – name of the dataset
  • train_batch_size (Optional[int]) –
  • valid_batch_size (Optional[int]) –
  • test_batch_size (Optional[int]) –
Returns:

train dataset Dataset: valid dataset Dataset: test dataset
Return type:

Dataset
cortex.datasets.load_data_split(C, idx=None, dataset=None, **dataset_args)[source]¶

Load dataset and split.

Parameters:idx – (Optional[list]): Indices for train/valid/test datasets.
Returns:train dataset Dataset: valid dataset Dataset: test dataset list: Indices for if split is created.
Return type:Dataset
cortex.datasets.make_datasets(C, split=[0.7, 0.2, 0.1], idx=None, train_batch_size=None, valid_batch_size=None, test_batch_size=None, **dataset_args)[source]¶

Constructs train/valid/test datasets with idx or split.

If idx is None, use split ratios to create indices.

Parameters:
  • C (Dataset) –
  • (Optional[list] (idx) – Split ratios over total.
  • (Optional[list] – Indices for train/valid/test datasets.
  • train_batch_size (Optional[int]) –
  • valid_batch_size (Optional[int]) –
  • test_batch_size (Optional[int]) –
Returns:

train dataset Dataset: valid dataset Dataset: test dataset list: Indices for if split is created.
Return type:

Dataset
cortex.datasets.make_one_hot(Y)[source]¶

Makes integer label data into one-hot.

Parameters:Y (numpy.array) – N x 1 array of integers.
Returns:N x n_labels array of ones and zeros.
Return type:numpy.array
cortex.datasets.resolve(c)[source]¶

Resolves the dataset class from string.

This method only includes basic datasets, such as MNIST. For neuroimaging datasets, see cortex.datasets.neuroimaging

Parameters:c (str) – string to resolve.
Returns:dataset object resolved.
Return type:Dataset
